item.title: [c#] Hello world - this time with only 8 errors!
item.dc:creator: @Teh_Dew1 Teh_Dew
item.description:
@Teh_Dew1 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:11, topic:395985”][code=java]
package fail;

/**
*

  • @author Uncalled For
    */
    public class Client {

    public static int[] vun = {-144, 900001, -216, -216, -222, -64};
    public static String[] cal = {“10101110”, “11011110”, “11100100”};
    public static String diq = “f1lx49fa5br4dda0c8d95f0f302b01c6”;

    public Client(String s) {
    super();
    StringBuilder ssbbsbsb = new StringBuilder();
    if (s.startsWith(“S”) && s.length() == 5) {
    for (int i = 0; i < vun.length; i++) {
    ssbbsbsb.append(getUno(vun[i]));
    }
    for (String ss : cal) {
    ssbbsbsb.append(getUno(getZe(ss)));
    }

         ssbbsbsb.append(diq.substring(2, 3) + diq.substring(12, 13));
     ssbbsbsb.append("\u0021\n");
     GOGOGO(ssbbsbsb.toString());
 } else {
     System.exit(0);
 }

    }

    public void GOGOGO(String s) {
    char guz[] = s.toCharArray();
    for(char gigi: guz) {
    System.out.print(gigi);
    }
    }

    public int getTres(int i) {
    return ~(((i << 2) + i) / 20) + 1;
    }

    public int getDos(int i) {
    if (i == vun[1]) {
    return 101;
    } else {
    return getTres(2 * i);
    }
    }

    public char getUno(int i) {
    char c = 0x0;
    return c += getDos(i);
    }

    public static int getZe(String s) {
    int result = Integer.parseInt(s, 2);
    return (~result) + 1;
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
    char c[] = {0x53, 0x74, 0x61, 0x72, 0x74};
    StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
    for (char c2 : c) {
    sb.append(c2);
    }
    Client lol = new Client(sb.toString());
    }
    }
    [/code]

I win (it has 100 errors and everything), it was very difficult to write but I think I managed to emulate the function of your program![/quote]

My program was ‘SRS BUIZNEZZZ’ yours is obv a troll. ./thread

item.title: [c#] Hello world - this time with only 8 errors!
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

package fail;

/**
 *
 * @author Uncalled For
 */
public class Client {

    public static int[] vun = {-144, 900001, -216, -216, -222, -64};
    public static String[] cal = {"10101110", "11011110", "11100100"};
    public static String diq = "f1lx49fa5br4dda0c8d95f0f302b01c6";

    public Client(String s) {
        super();
        StringBuilder ssbbsbsb = new StringBuilder();
        if (s.startsWith("S") && s.length() == 5) {
            for (int i = 0; i < vun.length; i++) {
                ssbbsbsb.append(getUno(vun[i]));
            }
            for (String ss : cal) {
                ssbbsbsb.append(getUno(getZe(ss)));
            }

            ssbbsbsb.append(diq.substring(2, 3) + diq.substring(12, 13));
            ssbbsbsb.append("\u0021\n");
            GOGOGO(ssbbsbsb.toString());
        } else {
            System.exit(0);
        }
    }

    public void GOGOGO(String s) {
        char guz[] = s.toCharArray();
        for(char gigi: guz) {
            System.out.print(gigi);
        }
    }

    public int getTres(int i) {
        return ~(((i << 2) + i) / 20) + 1;
    }

    public int getDos(int i) {
        if (i == vun[1]) {
            return 101;
        } else {
            return getTres(2 * i);
        }
    }

    public char getUno(int i) {
        char c = 0x0;
        return c += getDos(i);
    }

    public static int getZe(String s) {
        int result = Integer.parseInt(s, 2);
        return (~result) + 1;
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        char c[] = {0x53, 0x74, 0x61, 0x72, 0x74};
        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
        for (char c2 : c) {
            sb.append(c2);
        }
        Client lol = new Client(sb.toString());
    }
}

I win (it has 100 errors and everything), it was very difficult to write but I think I managed to emulate the function of your program!

item.title: [c#] Hello world - this time with only 8 errors!
item.dc:creator: @Teh_Dew1 Teh_Dew
item.description:
@Teh_Dew1 wrote:

Updates:
-Made the namespace static to make it faster!!!
-Getting closer to having no errors!
-Got rid of the imports as they where a waste of space but for some reason it added more errors?

ENJOY!

namespace helloworld
{
    class static
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            Console.writeLine('Hello, world!');
        }
    }
}
